wikipedia_page.main: William Edward Norris (18 November 1847 – 1925) was a London-born English fiction and writer. His first story, Heap of Money, appeared in 1877, and was followed by a long series of novels and stories, many of which first appeared in the Temple Bar and Cornhill magazines.

response: * Sir William Norris (judge) (died 1859), Chief Justice of British Ceylon, father of William Edward Norris
His son was the author William Edward Norris. His daughter Anne Grace Norris married the future Governor Arthur Havelock.
